solution_line_template: The Saturday morning exodus out of the park comprised {exodus_hours}*{exodus_rate} = <<{exodus_hours}*{exodus_rate}={exodus_total}>>{exodus_total} elephants
This means that after the exodus, the park was left with {initial_elephants} - {exodus_total} = <<{initial_elephants}-{exodus_total}={elephants_after_exodus}>>{elephants_after_exodus} elephants

Since the final number of elephants was {final_elephants}, the new elephants that entered were {final_elephants} - {elephants_after_exodus} = <<{final_elephants}-{elephants_after_exodus}={new_elephants}>>{new_elephants}
The rate at which the new elephants entered the park was therefore {new_elephants}/{entry_hours} = <<{new_elephants}/{entry_hours}={entry_rate}>>{entry_rate} elephants/hour
